Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Marketable \Mar"ket*a*ble\, a. 1. Fit to be offered for sale in a market; such as may be justly and lawfully sold; as, dacayed provisions are not marketable. [1913 Webster]
2. Current in market; as, marketable value. [1913 Webster]
3. Wanted by purchasers; salable; as, furs are not marketable in that country. [1913 Webster]

marketable adj 1: in demand by especially employers; "marketable skills" [syn: {in demand(p)}] 2: fit to be offered for sale; "marketable produce" [syn: {merchantable}, {sellable}, {vendable}, {vendible}] 3: capable of being marketed; "the marketable surplus"
